intro: Spachea perforata, commonly known as the perforate spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and opposite leaves with a distinctive perforation pattern. It produces small, inconspicuous yellowish flowers in clusters, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Spachea perforata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
